SIR NE Gillespie-Tau-Leaping-Algorithm Simulation Model

sim_tauGillespie_nSIR.Rd

SIR NE Gillespie-Tau-Leaping-Algorithm Simulation Model

Usage

sim_tauGillespie_nSIR(
  Iseed = 1,
  N = 10,
  beta = rep(1, 10),
  dur_I = 1,
  init_contact_mat = NULL,
  rho = 0.05,
  tau = 1,
  term_time = 500,
  return_contact_matrices = FALSE
)

Arguments

Iseed

integer; Number of initial infections in the population

N

integer; population size

beta

numeric vector, matrix, or sparseMatrix; Probability of transmission given contact for S_i I_j elements

dur_I

numeric; Duration of infection

init_contact_mat

matrix or sparseMatrix; User specified initial contact, or adjacency matrix. The contact matrix must be a symmetric square matrix, with a diagonal of 0 (for self), and have the same edge density, number of connections, for each node, or individual. Default value of NULL results in internal function generating initial contact matrix.

rho

numeric; network rewiring rate

tau

numeric; Tau step for efficient (but approximate) stochastic simulation\#' @description Gillespie Simulation

term_time

numeric; time termination condition

return_contact_matrices

boolean; Option to return contact matrices throughout dynamic iterations. Warning, this can be memory intensive.

Value

The return:

  • conn_traj boolean whether or not event included a rewiring

Details

Assuming:

  • closed population

If the user does not input an initial contact matrix, the package will generate an initial contat matrix with the same edge density for each node using the igraph::degree.sequence.game function
